frame.name: Being_obligated
frame.definition:
<def-root>Under some <fen>Condition</fen>, usually left implicit, a <fen>Responsible_party</fen> is required to perform some <fen>Duty</fen>. If they do not perform the <fen>Duty</fen>, there may be some undesirable <fen>Consequence</fen>, which may or may not be stated overtly.
<ex><ment>It</ment> <gov>is</gov> <fex name="Responsible_party">my</fex> <t>duty</t> <fex name="Duty">to fight any attack on the Brotherhood</fex> .</ex> <ex><fex name="Resp">This country</fex> has the <t>responsibility</t> <fex name="Duty">to support its citizens' right to express themselves</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Resp">I</fex> am <t>obligated</t> <fex name="Duty">to pay</fex> <fex name="Con">or they'll double the fine</fex>.</ex>
NB: Contrast this frame with Likelihood and Preconditions frames, which involve many of the same lemmas.
Many LUs which might be expected to be found here (should, must, have to) are actually in the Required_event frame. Our analysis is that these LUs do not evoke an obligation directly, although they are frequently used in contexts that are consistent with an understanding of obligation and are pragmatically strengthened to (defeasibly) imply an obligation. </def-root>

FE.name: Responsible_party
FE.definition: <def-root>The person who must perform the <fen>Duty</fen>. <ex><fex name="Resp">Everyone</fex> has the <t>obligation</t> to vote.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Duty
FE.definition: <def-root>The action that the <fen>Responsible_party</fen> is obligated to perform. <ex>My <t>job</t> is <fex name="Duty">to get to the other side of the bridge</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Condition
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE indicates the <fen>Condition</fen>s under which the <fen>Responsible_party</fen> is obligated to perform the <fen>Duty</fen>.
<ex><fex name="con">As a conscientious citizen</fex>, it is your <t>duty</t> to report any suspicious behavior.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Consequence
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Consequence</fen> will result if the <fen>Duty</fen> is not performed.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>The time interval during which the Responsibly_party is obligated to fulfill the Duty.
<ex><fex name="Time">At that time</fex> men were <t>obligated</t> to marry women from their own community.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>A location in which the <fen>Responsible_party</fen> has a specified <fen>Duty</fen> .
<ex>I almost forgot to tell you that <fex name="pla">in Sweden</fex> we are <t>obligated</t> to spend atleast 7.5 months in the army for training.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Frequency
FE.definition: <def-root>This frame element is defined as the number of times an event occurs per some unit of time. </def-root>
